alert.note: Alert for Mayes; McIntosh; Muskogee; Sequoyah; Wagoner (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 11 at 9:56PM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN DELAWARE... NORTHEASTERN MCINTOSH...NORTHWESTERN SEQUOYAH...SOUTHEASTERN MAYES... SOUTHEASTERN WAGONER...CHEROKEE AND MUSKOGEE COUNTIES THROUGH 1030 PM CST... At 956 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 2 miles west of Porter to 6 miles northwest of Oktaha to Stidham. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Muskogee... Tahlequah... Wagoner... Eufaula... Fort Gibson... Checotah... Warner... Gore... Okay... Webbers Falls... Hulbert... Porter... Oktaha... Braggs... Taft... Boynton... Council Hill... Rentiesville... Tullahassee... Stidham... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 255 and 291. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
